# Glosary
_Greedy Algorithm_: Used in optimization problems. Tries to approximate the overall optimal way to solve a problem by making step-wise optimal choices.

_Canonical Form_: Normal, standard way of describing a mathematical object. 

_Latent Variable_: Variable that is inferred from other variables. Not directly observed.

_Parameteric Model_: A statistical model that has all it's information represented in its parameters. Those are the only thing needed to predict future or unknown values.
